message.content:
There are a few different ways you could learn programming by hacking:

1. Capture the Flag (CTF) competitions: These events usually have various challenges that require participants to solve cyber security-related issues or exploit vulnerabilities in order to "capture the flag" and gain points for their team. Many CTFs cater to both beginners with easier challenges and more advanced players.

2. Vulnerable applications/websites: There are some popular intentionally vulnerable applications like OWASP WebGoat, DVWA (Damn Vulnerable Web App), and Metasploitable which provide hands-on opportunities for learning exploitation techniques and developing your skills as a hacker while practicing programming knowledge.

3. Online courses/tutorials focused on ethical hacking: Websites such as Cybrary, Hack The Box, HackerOne, TryHackMe, Offensive Security's training platforms offer online lessons that teach ethical hacking methodologies alongside relevant coding concepts.

4. Joining hacking forums/communities: Being active in these communities can help hone your programming skills as a result of interacting with experienced hackers who often share valuable guidance/resources related to ethical hacking methods and give tips related to computer languages used for penetration testing activities.

5. Studying existing exploits/scripts/tools: Analyzing how an existing tool works can provide practical insight into real-world implementations of diverse programming concepts while also teaching about specific technical aspects required within offensive security endeavors.

Remember always take precautions when working with potentially malicious tools or vulnerable environments â€“ work within virtual machines or isolated safe environments whilst staying ethically conscious throughout any activities undertaken.


Overall - simultaneously learning both subjects will make it much easier; incrementally building proficiency across each area during development towards becoming confident practitioners operating under appropriate contextual circumstances/frameworks adhering all terminology agreements bound from start-to-finish since inception/delivery
